Articles.Content:
So I decided to make a large version of my station solar panels (twice as large to be exact), but when I finished I noticed that the payload is bigger then the entire launch vehicle!

So that got me thinking, what are some of the biggest payloads you guys have put into orbit?

Edited May 26, 2013 by Cipher29
Why are your sepatrons on backwards? The decouplers at the top will push the cones away, but the sepatrons will only push them back.

Yeah, with space stations i did some launches where payload dwarfed the launcher But mostly it was connection modules made of girders etc, so weight was inside capabilities of my rockets. Stability and maneuverability of course was entirely different matter
